page.title: 10Local Government in Wootton
page.content: Local government is conducted at 3 levels: County, District and Parish. County and District Councillors are elected on political grounds, and at present belong to the Alliance party. The Parish Council consists of people well known to the community:the chair- man used to be headmaster of the local school. Parish Councillors are not chosen for their political views. We interviewed the local County Councillor, who is also a district councillor for another area. He told us that the main responsibilities of the County Council are education,the social services, highways, structure planning, public transport,the police, the fire-service and libraries. The District Council is responsible for housing, leisure, footpaths and roads. The main concern at the moment is that a good bus service should be preserved
